content.html:
About

My name is Alexander Soto. I’m an activist, educator, technologist and agent of social change. My interests are in exploring issues in community-building, social justice, education and leveraging technology to address social problems.

In the past I’ve worked as a labor rights organizer, an AmeriCorps member with United Way, a mentor at Resilient Coders and a technology teacher at the Margarita Muñiz Academy.

This blog is a collection of my thoughts on the intersection of technology and social justice while also documenting what I’m learning.

You can follow what I’m doing now and what I’m currently studying.
